snippet: Since the Ebola virus began spreading through West Africa, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has been pushing the worst-hit countries to implement screening for air passengers.
abstract: Thomas E Duncan, Liberian man visiting relatives in Dallas who has been confirmed to be first Ebola case in United States, was screened at airport for signs of disease before leaving Liberia.

byline.original: By MATTHEW L. WALD and JAD MOUAWAD

lead_paragraph: Since the Ebola virus began spreading through West Africa, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has been pushing the worst-hit countries to implement screening for air passengers.

headline.main: Man in U.S. With Ebola Had Been Screened to Fly, but System Is Spotty
headline.print_headline: Man in U.S. With Ebola Had Been Screened to Fly, but System Is Spotty

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
